elements.title: Shireen Abu Akleh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to investigations by independent press agencies, journalist Shireen Abu Akleh (pictured) was killed by an Israel Defense Forces bullet while wearing a blue "press" vest?

elements.title: tipping point (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Amazon rainforest may change into a savanna once it passes a tipping point?

elements.title: Carl-Gustav Groth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Carl-Gustav Groth was the first surgeon in Sweden to perform pancreas, liver, and islet cell transplants?

elements.title: Tashfiniya Madrasa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 14th-century Tashfiniya Madrasa in Tlemcen was demolished by French colonial authorities in 1876?

elements.title: Oscar Isaac possibly became the first Latino actor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2017, Oscar Isaac possibly became the first Latino actor to play Hamlet in a major US production?

elements.title: Windsor Street Gasworks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that three gasholders at the Windsor Street Gasworks were painted in the claret and blue colours of local football team Aston Villa?

elements.title: Larry Jeffrey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Canadian professional ice hockey player Larry Jeffrey had eleven knee surgeries in a span of nine years?

elements.title: Maine Television Network (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that among the special events broadcast by the Maine Television Network during its brief existence were a fashion show, a basketball tournament, and an ordination ceremony?
